text: does it make sense to get a wireless router sponsor? thinking about the work involved in "hacking" internet connected devices... sometimes its helpful to have your own admin access to a wireless router so you can know the IP addresses of the other devices on the network. Also helps avoid issues with too many devices on a single wireless network. note that each wireless router may still need a connection upstream to a internet pipe, which may mean some serious switches will be in order.
I don't think so - Simple preferred that we keep it to the guest network (which supports 500+ people)
We just got a grip of hardware from these guys <http://aeotec.com/>

attachments.title: Aeotec by Aeon Labs • creators of Z-Wave products

text: some coding directions may require admin access to that guest network to see and setup fixed IP addresses
